mobs.LongDesc: A member of the Watch is patrolling the streets
mobs.DetailedDesc:
The watchman is a sturdy-looking, battle-hardened warrior, who is just as
accustomed to battling monsters in defense of Waterdeep as he is roughing
up the petty scum like you who hang around the city to make trouble.

mobs.LongDesc: A member of the Guard is here, standing watch over the citizens
mobs.DetailedDesc:
The cityguard may not be experienced in combat, but he is well-equipped and
well trained. He eyes you with suspicion and puts a hand to his weapon as you
look at him. You have to understand, he's trained to pick out potential
trouble-makers and criminals like yourself. No offense! He's just doing his
job.

mobs.LongDesc: A jailor sits here, with his back up against the cell door
mobs.DetailedDesc:
The jailor looks to be the lazy sort. Keeping "guard" on drunken prisoners
while having several members of the Watch around all the time isn't the
most taxing job in the world. The jailor has obviously been in better shape
in his life. The flab of old muscles, long since replaced by fat, is easily
seen. In his younger days he probably would have been a force to be
reckoned with, but now he seems a bit ridiculous. You wonder if this job
wasn't some sort of political appointment...

mobs.LongDesc: An odd-looking, drunken adventurer is screaming to be released
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This female adventurer is an odd one indeed. She has horns growing from
the top of her head, and her eyes glow a dull red, as well as a set of
leathery wings folded neatly behind her back. When she notices you staring,
she explains that she had been an elven man, but a foul atrifact altered
her form, er his form...whatever. The gender change was a result of a 
different accident. *sigh* yup, definitely an adventurer.
    Regardless of her gender, and the fact that shee looks like a demon,
she's built like a linebacker, and could probably rip you in two. As drunk
as she is, you wonder if it wouldn't be a good idea to ask about being
moved to another cell.

mobs.LongDesc: A ridiculous-looking adventuring priest is wandering around wearing a pot
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This has to be the strangest priest you have ever seen. He's wearing a pot
on his head as if it were some sort of helmet, and carrying a chicken
under each arm. If he is any indication of the priests around these parts,
you pray that you don't need any healing from the locals.

mobs.LongDesc: A retired wizard sits here, reading an ancient book on some obscure topic
mobs.DetailedDesc:
When you first look at him, you think he's one of those foolish scholars
that wouldn't know the first thing about the real world if it ran up and
breath-weaponed him. But when he notices you looking at him, he fixes you
with a quick glare, and in a split second you know that he has sized you
up. You suddenly stop thinking of his worn robes as those of a isolated
scholar, and realize that they are the well-worn robes of a powerful,
    Seeming to have dismissed you as any possible threat, he goes back to
reading his book.

mobs.LongDesc: Khelben grumbles and at you and looks up from his spell-book
mobs.DetailedDesc:
The Lord Mage of Waterdeep:
   Khelben is one of the most powerful mages in the world, and he acts
like it. Though he's dressed only in a simple, white, house robe, his
physical presence is intimidating. Far from being frail and weak, he is
a large, robust man, with a thick beard that is only beginning to show signs
of graying; though there are rumors that he is really over 200 years old.
   His youthful appearance is due to the fact that he is one of Mystra's
Chosen. A small number of Mystra's mortal followers hold within them
a small portion of her divine power, keeping them from aging as fast as
other mortals, as well as protecting them from mental attacks.
   Khelben's nickname, "Blackstaff," comes from the staff of power he made,
and named The Blackstaff.

mobs.LongDesc: Khelben's wife, Laeral, stands here teaching the apprentices
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Laeral is one of the Seven Sisters, a group of women who have chosen to 
follow Mystra, and are among Her Chosen. As such, all of them appear
to be much younger than the hundreds of years they have lived.
   Not to be overshadowed by he husband's wizardry, Laeral is an archmage
in her own right.

mobs.LongDesc: An apprentice is listening attentively to his teacher
mobs.DetailedDesc: This newbie mage is unarmed and doesn't seem to be too dangerous

mobs.LongDesc: A priestess of Mystra kneels in prayer to her goddess
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This retired adventuring priestess has taken up a more active role in the
church of the Lady of Mysteries. Though she seems content to remain a
productive member of society, her calm bearing around dangerous people
like yourself shows that she hasn't lost the "edge" that keeps one's 
skills from deteriorating. Before you think of attacking her, remember:
she is a priestess of the goddess who grants the power of all mages...

mobs.LongDesc: A shady character hides in the shaows
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This guys seems to want to keep out of sight at all costs. The thieves
and cutthroats here seem to be perfectly willing to leave him alone too.
The points on his ears show that he carries some elven blood in him
which explains why his eyes glow a dull red in the darkness.
 An interesting fetish hangs from his neck, and he keeps it guarded with
one hand constantly. Perhaps it's safety is the reason he is trying to keep
hidden.

mobs.LongDesc: A beautiful elven bard sings a haunting melody.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
She's a welcome relief to look upon for weary travellers. She also seems
to be making plenty of money, judging by the number of coins the partons
are throwing to her. But like many of the people here, she just seems to be
stopping here to rest from a long journey. Like all adventurers, she
doesn't seem to like staying put.

mobs.LongDesc: A thief sees you enter the hideout and attacks
mobs.DetailedDesc: They stab first, ask questions later

mobs.LongDesc: a disgusting troll lumbers toward you
mobs.DetailedDesc: The troll looks remarkably like a troll. It wants to eat you.

mobs.LongDesc: an orc makes a feeble attempt at an ambush, but you spot it easily
mobs.DetailedDesc: The orc looks remarkably like an orc. It wants to eat you.

mobs.LongDesc: a barbarian warrior watches you warily, wondering if you have honor
mobs.DetailedDesc:
The barbarian looks exactly like a barbarian. He doesn't look like he wants
to eat you though *phew*

mobs.LongDesc: a foreign-looking mage wanders the city.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Dressed in white robes uncommon for wizards of this area of the North,
this wizard stands out in a crowd. In fact, his whole demeanor suggests
that he's not from around these parts. Since he is most definitely an
adventurer, it wouldn't surprise you to find out that he's not from this
world (some DM's let you get away with anything these days).

mobs.LongDesc: a street vendor is shouting about his wares at the top of his lungs.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Don't you just hate these guys?! They seem to be the only people
who never get a sore throat from too much yelling, and they're the ones
you most _want_ to have a sore throat. He continually yells out claim
after claim about whatever he is selling (he's a bit vague about what it
actually is), and hardly pauses for breath. From his well-tailored clothes,
however, you realize that he's doing good business (people must pay
him to shut up).

mobs.LongDesc: a street performer is here, working the crowd.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
You have trouble seeing the performer through thecrowd that's watching
him. Then you notice it...his face is painted white, and he's not talking,
just gesturing with his hands. It's a MIME!! As your rage boils at the
thought of such a being, he notices that evil, psychotic glint in your
eyes...he knows you've got to try to kill him (principles and all). The
mime starts to construct an invisible barrier with his hands (looks like
he's definining the walls of a box).

mobs.LongDesc: a travelling merchant is bringing foreign goods to trade.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Fine clothes, bulging purse, oversized waistline...yup, it's a merchant
all right. The bane of all adventurers: they call the watch when robbed,
charge you for buying things, and just generally provide annoyance
to anyone used to working outside the normal corporate power structure.
If it weren't for the fact that they are rich enough to afford bodyguards,
adventurers would most likely have hunted them to the brink of extinction
centuries ago.

mobs.LongDesc: A fat Cormyrian merchant, smiles as you enter his shop.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This portly gentleman seems to have carved out quite a niche for
himself in the area of magic-sales. His clothes are exotic, and look
somewhat mystical, though you're fairly certain that's only for show.
He seems friendly enough, and willing to help you shop. Just be careful,
he didn't become successful by letting adventurers walk off with cheap
deals.

mobs.LongDesc: A clerk is here, ready to sell you what you need.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This little man is the model of efficiency. He is knowledgeable on
every subject you could possible ask about...in the area of dry goods.
Just let him know what you need, and he can get you anything...as 
long as it's on the list of stuff the store sells.

mobs.LongDesc: The drow ranger, Drizzt Do'Urden, watches you carefully
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This is the legendary drow ranger, Drizzt Do'Urden. Born as the second son
of the ninth house of Menzoberranzan, Daermon N'a'shezbaernon, he was
raised in one of the harshest environments know to sentient beings. 
Though he was brought up by a race of killers, Drizzt had a sense
of honor, taught to him by his father, and weapons-master, Zaknafein
Do'Urden. Drizzt left the cruelty of his race behind and fled to the Underdark,
where everyday survival is a struggle, and lived there for a decade. He
eventually made his way to the surface where his honor and
abilities won him acceptance with his friends here in Mithril Hall. Don't
be fooled by his slender appearance, for no one has lived who could
defeat Drizzt in single combat.

mobs.LongDesc: Drizzt's panther ally, Guenhwyvar, awaits her master's call
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Big
Powerful
Loyal
Guenhwyvar has served Drizzt loyally since he released her from enslavement to 
an evil drow mage named Masoj Hun'ett

mobs.LongDesc: Wulfgar stands here, brooding
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This young barbarian warrior is very different from his people. He was taken
prisoner by Bruenor after a battle, and as raised to manhood among the dwarves.
He worked in the mines and forges of the dwarven settlement in Icewind Dale,
and his strength grew to a level unheard of among humans.
    Having found a soft spot in Bruenor's heart, the dwarf crafted Aegis-Fang
and gave it to Wulfgar - an extraodinary gift, given the strong enchantments on
the hammer. When Bruenor set out on his quest to find Mithril Hall, took up
his hammer and went along, eager to find adventure.
   Far from being a brutish warrior, Wulfgar learned to fight cunningly,being
taught by the best, Drizzt Do'Urden. At times it seems as if his former teacher
is the only one who could still best him.

mobs.LongDesc: Bruenor Battlehammer, 8th King of Mithril hall, stands here
mobs.DetailedDesc:
As tough as the mountain stone and twice as stubborn. Bruenor has survived
ordeals that would have killed orges, and walked away every time. His gruff
demeanor and the battle scars, including a missing eye, tell you in no
uncertain terms that this is not the dwarf to make an enemy of.
    The last living survivor of the dwarves' flight from Mithril Hall, his
lifelong ambition was to reclaim his homeland, and his birthright as king.
Little more than a lad when he last saw the Hall, his set out on a quest to
first find, then reconquer Mithril Hall. Along with Drizzt, Wulfgar, and
Regis, he scoured the northlands until he found it.
    Now, as the eighth King of Mithril Hall, Bruenor has lost none of his
fighting edge.

mobs.LongDesc: Bruenor's adopted daughter, Catti-brie, smiles at you
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Bruenor's adopted human daughter, Catti-brie was raised by the dwarves of
clan Battlehammer as one of their own. Despite being raised by gruff, stern
dwarves, Catti-brie still managed to keep a cheerfu l attitude. It was her
that introduced Drizzt to Bruenor, since she was not predjudiced against the
drow because of his race.
    Catti-brie appears out of place among the dwarves. A young woman now, she
has beatiuful auburn hair and deep blue eyes. many who first meet her are
surprised by her beauty, expecting a girl raised by dwarves to look a little
more dwarf-like. Appearances aside, her fiery temper and blunt honesty betray
her parenting. She has also learned to defend herself, being taught by Bruenor
himself.

mobs.LongDesc: That lazy halfling, Regis, is wandering around
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Like all members of his unambitious race, he prides himself on his ability to
do the least amount of work he can get away with. Consequently, he spent
his early years as an up and coming thief on the streets on Calimport. But,
when he "received" a "gift" from his guildmaster, an invaluable magical gem,
he was forced to flee to the lands of the North.
     He found a home in the cities of Ten-Towns, beyond the boundaries of
civilization. He also made a friend of Breunor Battlehammer, the leader of a
small dwarven clan. When Breunor set out with Drizzt and Wulfgar, Regis
accompanied them on their journey....to find Mithril Hall.
     With the success of that quest, he was welcomed to stay with the
dwarves in their reclaimed ancestral home.

mobs.LongDesc: That lazy halfling, Regis, is wandering around
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Wait! This isn't Regis!!!!
     The master assassin, Aremis Entreri, has used a magical mask to take Regis'
place. Despite the fact that he appears as a halfling, he is actually a human, and
a deadly one. Sent the the master of the thieves' huild in Calmiport, Pasha Pook,
he is hunting for Regis...to answer for stealing the magical gem he now has.
    However, Entreri is a master swordsman, and ever since his first encounter
with Drizzt, he has become obsessed with proving himself to be the drow's
better in combat. Even his mission to capture Regis has been distorted toward
this end...he wants Regis as bait to lure Dizzt out.
    The irony of Entreri's quest is that every time he faces Drizzt, he loses more
of his superiority, for he narrowly escaped death at Drizzt's hands several times.
    Entreri is good.......But Drizzt Do'Urden is the true master.

mobs.LongDesc: Thibbledorf Pwent, the most wild battlerager, growls at you menacingly
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This is perhaps the most offensive being you have ever encountered.
    His razor-sharp, spiked armor is greased thoroughly, but still creaks and
squeals, grating on your nerves. He smells worse than any 10 dwarves you've
met, and it's seems a safe bet that he has _never_ bathed. His personality
also leaves a lot to be desired. He is crude, vulgar, and bluntly honest, telling
you exactly how little he thinks of you.
   However, he seems to be a formidable oppenent: his armor is composed of
razor sharp bands of steel, designed more to slice an enemy to ribbons than to
defend him. At every join and seeming every possible point, spiked portrude
from his "armor," and his ehlmet serves simple to hold in place the 2 foot
spike adorns the top of his head.
    Only his fanatical loyalty (and the fact that he fights better than any in the
Hall, save Drizzt) keeps him tolerated.

mobs.LongDesc: The corpse of a shadow dragon is lying here.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
It isn't dead!!!
    Shimmergloom, the great shadow dragon that routed clan Battlehammer from
Mithril hall over 200 years ago, was though to be dead. Forgotten in the new
found prosperity of the Hall, Shimmergloom has been recovering from its
horrendous wounds.

mobs.LongDesc: a dwarven miner extracts precious mithril from the mines
mobs.DetailedDesc:
A sturdy-looking dwarf, this miner is preoccupied with finding mithril. Not
that it's tough to find, but the miner won't be distracted from this job. You 
start to wonder whether this dwarf is male or female... for non-dwarves, it's
tough to tell.

mobs.LongDesc: a dwarven miner extracts precious mithril from the mines
mobs.DetailedDesc:
A sturdy-looking dwarf, this miner is preoccupied with finding mithril. Not
that it's tough to find, but the miner won't be distracted from this job. You 
start to wonder whether this dwarf is male or female... for non-dwarves, it's
tough to tell.

mobs.LongDesc: General Dagnabit is here, looking for Bruenor
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Having first met Bruenor when King Harbromme of Citadel Adbar sent 8000 troops
to help Bruenor reconquer Mirthil Hall, Dagnabit stayed on after the victory
as general of the Hall's army. It is his duty to make sure that the forces of
the evil races of the Underdark don't gain entrance to Mithril Hall. He takes
his position very seriously, and is constantly updating Bruenor as to the
current state of the city's defense...much to Bruenor's annoyance. But
Dagnabit does his job well, and Bruenor tolerates his overzealousness.

mobs.LongDesc: a dwarven soldier patrols the Undercity
mobs.DetailedDesc:
A grim look of determination is fixed onto the face of this soldier. As the
front line of defense against an invasion from the Underdark, he knows that he
will be among the first to die in such a battle. He accepts his fate
willingly, and hopes that he doesn't die until he has taken out a few of the
invading scum.

mobs.LongDesc: a dwarven mithril-smith shows off his latest work
mobs.DetailedDesc:
A look of pride crosses this dwarf's face as he shows you the latest
masterpiece he has forged. You're actually quite impressed by his skill, and
if he is typical of the smiths in the city, the dwarves will soon be very
rich.

mobs.LongDesc: The dwarves' master armorer is at one with the god of craft
mobs.DetailedDesc:
*DO NOT ATTACK HIM, YOU WILL DIE*
  Buster is the greatest of the dwarven armorers, and right now he is being
protected by Moradin, the dwarven god of craft. Buster's work must not
be interrupted and Moradin will give him the power to slay anything that
attampts to harm him.
